text: Hi all, is it possible to create my own "Starter Theme"  , hosted on github for example,  that i can fetch as a start for a project like it can be done with the command " `hs fetch @HubSpot/barricade` "  ?

Not exactly. So some clarity here. `@HubSpot`  is actually a special folder that all HubSpot accounts have access to and it stores HubSpot created and maintained modules and now themes. That directory is read-only.

What you CAN do is yes have your theme on github, and users could do a `git clone` of your repository, and then do a `hs upload`  to upload the files to their HubSpot account.
Does anyone know of marketplace LP and TYP templates that use themes?
Themes aren't in the marketplace yet
Does anyone know when they will be?
Not a clue. You could grab one of the default themes provided by HubSpot - <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/themes/default-themes>
So this problem still persists on global modules. I have tested in multiple portals

As advised by the great <@U22VBL87M>, I have added a package.json file that shortens my commands. Eg `npm run start` will start a hs watch.  You could extend this by adding a git clone command to start off your project.
This is a fun thing to think about
